channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Getting hired in 2026 is all about your ‘microcredentials’ says CEO of $1.3 billion learning platform—this is what he tells Gen Z to focus on
item.description: "We do see a big spike in enrollments, typically, in January," Coursera CEO, Greg Hart, tells Fortune in an exclusive interview. "It's sort of like gy...

item.title: Bolsonaro undergoes medical procedure to treat severe hiccups
item.description: Bolsonaro is currently in prison after being convicted by the Supreme Court of attempting to carry out a coup following his electoral defeat in 2022.

item.title: GE HealthCare CEO Peter Arduini is forging a new chapter for the $20 billion-a-year business while drawing on Jack Welch’s legacy
item.description: Arduini is trying to channel the ‘GE of old’ as he pursues a world where ‘health care has no limits’

item.title: Jeffrey R. Holland, next in line to lead Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints, dies at 85
item.description: Holland died early Saturday morning from complications associated with kidney disease, the church announced on its website.

item.title: Brutal year for stock picking spurs trillion-dollar fund exodus
item.description: Around $1 trillion was pulled from active equity mutual funds over the year, according to estimates from Bloomberg Intelligence using ICI data.
